pullRequest.title: GSIM and GLIM with test cases (FINERACT-603)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
fixed some bugs in gsim_glim and created the Integration test for it.
Checklist
Please make sure these boxes are checked before submitting your pull request - thanks!


 Commit message starts with the issue number from
#527


 Coding conventions at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FINERACT/Coding+Conventions have been followed.


 API documentation at https://github.com/apache/fineract/blob/develop/api-docs/apiLive.htm has been updated with details of any API changes.


 Integration tests have been created/updated for verifying the changes made.


 All Integrations tests are passing with the new commits.


 Submission is not a "code dump".  (Large changes can be made "in repository" via a branch.  Ask on the list.)


Our guidelines for code reviews is at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FINERACT/Code+Review+Guide

nodes.bodyText: @rrpawar96 if client/front end application generates same applicationID for two applications- it would mix up the child applications.  Although the chances are very low, we should see if we can synchronize access to submitApplication() through its parent submitGSIMApplication().
@rrpawar96  you may want to create an object and lock this loop until it completes processing. If you are able to do it, you can remove applicationID param altogether.

These two OpenJPA configuration changes here (EagerFetchMode & SubclassFetchMode) strike me as major data access changes that perhaps should not be "hidden" within this PR.. would you be willing to raise a new JIRA and a separate PR and remove this from here so that it can be reviewed and discussed in its own right?

nodes.bodyText:
I think instead of throwing exception over here, we should let Client know about about incorrect param.
By throwing exceptions, we sometimes reveal too much of inner mechanism to clients- just my thought.
There are too many whitespaces and new line throughout the PR- just try to eliminate them, if possible.

Please note, whenever we send a PR, it should contain either refactoring commit or new change commit. If the PR contains both then we should have first refactoring and then new feature commit.
I know its difficult, to judge initially whether the change you are going to make is going to be either refactoring or new change. But practicing such behavior makes it easy for reviewer. It also helps to understand the impact the PR is going to have on the existing functionality.
Note to self: in this mammoth file there are two effective changes : getter setter for loan type and GLIM object.

This would have been painful during writing test cases and cause of many NPEs, I see gsimID and glimID added in commandProcessingResult result but in commandWrapper, we are mapping glimID and gsimID to entityID.
This has made it asymmetric and doesn't go well with Test infra. If possible take these new  instance variables out.
If locking mechanism is added- applicationID can be removed altogether. Try the synchronization i suggested and omit this change if possible.

nodes.bodyText:
Including hyphens in account number would increase readability but some of the central banks won't like.
I am aware of such incident, where one of the MF had account number with hyphen printed on cheque and clearing house refused to process it.
most of the stuff is repetitive while creating child account, try extracting function so it becomes readable and will reduce lines of code.
Can we align GLIM creation with that of GSIM creation, I dont' see bulk creation in GLIM.
pass gsimID as object param.
do we need this?- please remove if not.
extract function of repetitive code.
see if you can remove gsim id altogether from commandProcessingResult.
omit hyphens in account numbers.
For now you can keep this, we will revisit these two new params when we do more testing and see if refactoring is possible.
